DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Surface Area Non-Cellular Component Percentage Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the non-cellular component if present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Surface Area Non-Cellular Component Percentage Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The extended two-dimensional outer boundary of a three-dimensional object._The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary._A term that refers to the non-cellular component of the innate immune system which includes cytokines, chemokines, complements, and other mediators of inflammation, to the non-cellular component of blood (plasma), or the non-cellular component of body fluids and broncoalveolar lavage fluid._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: The extended two-dimensional outer boundary of a three-dimensional object.
The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

A term that refers to the non-cellular component of the innate immune system which includes cytokines, chemokines, complements, and other mediators of inflammation, to the non-cellular component of blood (plasma), or the non-cellular component of body fluids and broncoalveolar lavage fluid.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
